The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide

wikitext.*:
[[File:1958 - 02-15 - to Wordsworth (1).jpg|thumb|350px|Letter to Wordsworth]] On [[17 February]] [[1958]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Jonathan Wordsworth'''.[http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/tolkien-book-store/000332.htm Wordsworth note] at [http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/ Tolkien Library] (accessed 13 April 2023) *'''Subject:''' Tolkien invites Wordsworth for dinner. *'''Publication:''' A short summary was included in [[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]].[[Christina Scull]] and [[Wayne G. Hammond]] ([[2017]]), ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]'': I. Chronology, p. 548 ==Transcription== {{blockquote|12:45 am Monday 17/2/58
My dear Wordsworth,
Tuesday Feb. 25. Dinner at 7:30. I shall be in my room (Fellows 4) from 7 p.m. onwards. I cannot guarantee any entertainment, but it will be delightful to see you again. Yours J.R.R.T.}} ==Notes== *Wordsworth added a note in red pen that reads:'' 'Flattering, don't you think, that he should write even before going to bed!' ''(in reference to the time of writing). *His son Charles Wordsworth sold the letter in 2006. The money was used to purchase a billiard table. {{references}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wordsworth, Jonathan}} {{title}} [[Category:Letters]]
